Just finished the story and i can honestly say that this is my favorite classic games on steam, even if this hasn't got a multiplayer. I remember since i was a kid my father bought this game for my birthday. Started my game up and ran like shit. 14 years later bought this game and was amazed how this game has amazing effects. The one thing i hate about this are mods. This is my first proper review i did.

Half - Life 2 - one of the best single player fps games.

Pros:
> Gameplay - smooth and fun, good pace aswell
> Story - interesting and the characters you interact with add to it greatly
> Voice acting - awsome
> Controls - simple, anyone can pick up and play
> Level Designs are so well done especially ravenholm
> Atompshere of the game is just perfection

Cons:
Honestly i can not find any faults apart from the graphics will become dated in time.

clichÃ© at this point but we could do with a half life 3 to see what happens next in the story



 Overall - A fantastic fps single player game 10/10

The Half-Life Series is hands down my favorite series of all time. Half Life 2 takes place over a decade past where the original Half Life started, you still play as the protagonist Gordon Freeman from the original. Although this time you play in a future almost steampunk society where the main Antagonist known as the "Combine" has taken rule over earth. 

Gordon must face some of the original foes and some new ones like the Overwatch transhuman forces. The transhuman forces are cybernetic elite infintry AKA cyborg soldiers. These soldiers have quite intelligent dialogue calling out your position, range and grid and will use grenades to flush you out. overall the combine soldiers easily are some of my favorite foes of all time kind of resembling storm troopers from star wars. though their ai is a little dated i still find them enjoyable to go up against.

Killing every enemy in the games is VERY satisfying since the source engines physics and ragdolls are very realistic (besides occasional ragdoll clipping). you can manipulate physics with the new addition known as the gravity gun, you can litteraly throw toilets, chairs, boulders and more at the enemy it is amusing.

The scripted eventsfrom the combine soldiers resemble some strategic tactics. Such as setting explosives up behind hidden areas and then detonating them to block the players way to give way to an ambush. stay on your toes if your new to this game as the combine will catch you off guard. The combine also utilize biological weapons, such as the headcrab canister which comes in as traditional artillery except when the shell lands headcrabs are released and borrow in the ground waiting to zombify anyone who comes in contact with the headcrabs.The combine are a cruel and ruthless enemy.

The game isnt just a shooter its also an adventure game with some parts you must explore antlion infested terrain to infiltrating a highly secure combine facility. the player will also go into an old town infested with headcrab zombies. The town previously was for city 17 escapees seeking refuge, however the combine didnt take to kindly to this ultimately leading to the ghost town Ravenholm.

As Gordon Freeman you single handedly watch the city go through different phases. When Gordon arrives the city has checkpoints everywhere requiring IDs and certain amount "precint" points in order to get through. The cities being constantly patrolled by the Metropolice. to constant raids and beatdown carried out by the Metro police. Later once the combine catches whiff of Gordons return the city goes into high alert and the combine start raiding all resistance strongholds and spreading general chaos killing all resistance. Even gunning civillians down up against the walls who were unarmed resistence members. Later in the game Gordon escapes city 17 going through the wastelands and canals going station to station in the underground railroad that is a network developed to help citizens get out of the city. however since Gordons arrival many stations have been raided or infested by headcrabs from the combine, only few stations are occupied throughout Gordons travel. more and more throughout the game you witness the combine losing more grip every chapter. after Gordon unintentionally destroys Nova Prospekt (combine stronghold and soldier manufacturing plant) the uprising begins. The streets flooded with debris and burning building and countless fire fights between the combine and the Resistence. it really is satisfying knowing you are the one single handedly responsible for starting the uprising ultimately taking down the combine.

I can go on forever about this game. its a very nostalgic expirience and i still continue to this day to traditionally play this series over and over again.

Game had me hooked. Then the end came. ;-; i cri every tiem. I just wanted to see the story progress... But I guess that would not make for great gameplay.


But onto the review: Excellent. It's like the Lord of the Rings of the gaming world, you cannot miss it, and even if it is a little bit antiquated, it is still well worth the 10 bucks. The gameplay is diverse and satisfying, the story is good (though I would honestly not have inserted the end. That's just a sucky copout.), and the graphics... Well, they are obviously old. But  it is still a nice looking game.

My third favorite Valve game. The game has a very important story, big maps and a little bit idiot AI. When you love to play with TF2 or Garry's Mod, you will find it nice. Try it, if you want to get a lot of fun and rage.

Half Life 2 has a very nice and compeling story.
If the story doesn't suit you then you could play the episodes, which are just a continuation of the main game.

The gameplay is okay for the most part.
The puzzles are sensible and they're not too difficult.
The gunplay is okay for the most part. It gets better once you get your hands on the gravity gun.
The best game of Valve 10/10
It's just great. Hope Hl3 come out soon !
